title: Recreational and a fun-filled tour to a happening Konkan State- Goa
text:
5, 2015 
Goa has so much for the fun-loving tourists. Whenever we think of a beach holiday, no place can beat Goa. The Party capital of India, Goa is always ready to welcome its guests. Here is a brief description of the place. 
Goa is amazing. It offers a huge attraction and it is a go-to destination for travellers of any age. Temples, churches, great beaches, old Portuguese style buildings and the Goan culture, Goa is packed with attractions. The best time to visit Goa is from November to February. You can easily choose December, the month of Christmas carnival and New Year eve parties. The cool climate is an advantage. Well, maybe it is too crowded during this time but it is absolutely fine when you are in Goa. The crowd, dazzling nightlife and loudness are the essences of Goa. 

Baga and Calangute beaches are the major attractions during this time. The beaches are well decorated and if you want to enjoy some water sports like parasailing and snorkeling, it is better you do advance booking with the help of different Goa tour packages. These packages are very helpful as it includes flight or train tickets, hotels, restaurants and sightseeing, that too, all under your preferable budgets. Hotels are all located in the prime locations and near to the beaches. There are many luxury hotels in Miramar too. From Santa Monica Jetty, Goa tourism operates cruise on River Mondovi. It is a wonderful experience and the spectacular view of the Miramar and the neighbouring towns from the sea is an enduring one. 

Old Goa is 9 km east of Panjim. It was the principal city during Portuguese reign. The remains of the bygone era, churches and convents are beautifully preserved. Exploring this region is a must if you want a glimpse of Portuguese architectures. 

Goa is often dubbed as the party capital of India as the state is full of life. An almost no restrictions place, Goa is full of surprises and beach parties. The beaches are discovered by hippies and now you will see foreigners are more involved in beach parties than Indians. However, when you are on the beach enjoying the bright sun and the breathtaking Arabian Sea, there is no discrimination. The surreal beauty of the white sand and the blue sea will win your heart. 

There are some cool places to visit in this happening Konkan state, Goa. Calangute Beach, Anjuna Beach, Basilica of Bom Jesus which is a World Heritage Site, Baga Beach, Sao Antonio Island, Rachol seminary Church, Chapora Fort, Candolim Beach, Goa State Museum, and many more places to add in your itinerary. 

Dabolim is the main airport of Goa. It is situated 29 km away from Panaji (the capital of Goa). Regular flights from other major cities of the country connect Goa. There are more than 5 Bangalore to Goa flights which operate at different hours of the day. International flights to UK and Germany are there as well. Margao and Vasco-da-Gama are its two railway stations. Direct trains are available from Mumbai and other cities of the country. Goa's roads are in good condition and both state-owned and private buses are available from other neighbouring cities to Goa. Well, hiring a scooter or a car for sightseeing is now a common trend in Goa.
